{{infobox shopping mall | | shopping_mall_name = SM City Fairview | image = SM City Fairview Logo.png | image_width = 200px | image_alt = SM City Fairview logo | caption = ''"We've got it all for you!"''
''500 reasons to shop and dine!''
''"The view just got better!"''
''"The Biggest Shopping Mall In North Metro Area"'' | location = Quirino Highway cor. Regalado Avenue & Beltfast Avenue, Brgy. Greater Lagro & Brgy Pasong Putik, Novaliches, Quezon City, Philippines | opening_date = {{Â·}}'''Main Mall:''' ''October 25, 1997''
{{Â·}}'''Annex One:''' ''May 24, 2004''
{{Â·}}'''Annex Two:''' ''January 15, 2009'' | developer = [[SM Prime Holdings]] | manager = [[SM Prime Holdings]] | architect = Palafox & Associates (old main building)
[[Point Design Inc.]] (renovations & annex) | location for = mall shows, album launches, flagship stores and premiere nights. | floor_area = 182,783 mÂ² | number_of_stores = 500 shops and restaurants | number_of_anchors = 22 | parking = 2000+ cars | floors = {{Â·}}'''Main Bldg.:''' ''4''
{{Â·}}'''Annex:''' ''2''
{{Â·}}'''New Annex :''' ''3'' | number_of_buildings = 3 Buildings (The Main & the 2 annexes) | website = [http://smsupermalls.com/smsupermalls/index.php?p=651&mall=12 SM City Fairview Official Website] }} '''SM City Fairview''' is a large shopping mall in the Philippines owned and operated by [[SM Prime Holdings]]. It is located along Quirino Highway, Regalado Ave, Novaliches, Quezon City, Metro Manila. It is the second [[SM Supermall]] in Quezon City. It has a land area of 200,000 mÂ², a total gross floor area of approximately 182,000 mÂ² and a total area of 220,000 mÂ², making it the 6th largest shopping mall of SM in the Philippines after [[SM City North EDSA]], [[SM Megamall]], [[SM City Cebu]] and [[SM Southmall]] in terms of total floor area. ==Physical details== SM City Fairview is a part of the SM malls triplets designed by Palafox and Associates --- a concept that was employed by SM at the height of Asian Financial Crisis, of building 3 shopping malls in different areas under one design template. Thus, the mall's exterior facade and interior has similarities to [[SM City Bacoor]] and [[SM City Iloilo]]. The mall was opened in October 1997 and underwent expansions in 2004 and 2009. The mall consists of a rectangle-shaped building and an outdoor parking. The mall features anchors like SM Department Store, The SM Supermarket, SM Hypermarket and SM Cinemas. It also features other anchors like National Bookstore, Watsons Personal Care Store, Our Home, Surplus Shop, SM Appliance Center and ACE Builders Center. Subsequent annex constructions and renovations were designed by Point Design and JRP Design Inc (Annex Two). SM City Fairview offers free Wi-Fi connectivity within its premises. SM City Fairview also has 4 major tenant zones. The SM Food Court on the Lower Ground Floor of the Main Building, SM Cyberzone at the Third Level of Main Building and the Health and Wellness Zones. The first Health and Wellness zone is located on the Lower Ground Floor of The New Annex. The second Health and Wellness Zone is located at the Second Floor of the Main Building and was launched on July 16, 2010 after the opening of the Cyberzone. ==Mall's Anchors and Zones== === Major Anchors === * SM Department Store * SM Supermarket * SM Appliance Center * SM Hypermarket * SM Bowling * SM Storyland ===Major Tenant Zones=== * SM Foodcourt * Cyberzone * Health and Wellness Zone (2) == Incidents == * On September 18, 2009, a student jumped to death from the 3rd level of the main building, in an apparent suicide. [http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/breakingnews/metro/view/20090919-226021/Student-jumps-to-his-death-in-mall Student jumps to his death in mall], "Inquirer.net", 2009-09-19. Retrieved on 2011-09-29. * On October 17, 2010, a 19-year old student was killed after jumping from the 2nd level of the main building.[http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/inquirerheadlines/metro/view/20101019-298467/19-year-old-jumps-to-death-in-QC-mall 19-year-old jumps to death in QC mall], "Inquirer.net", 2010-10-19.
